concise_definition: adj. 甘愿接受的, 顺从的; v. 辞职, 辞去

definitions.explanation_en: Accepting an unpleasant situation without protest, often because one believes resistance is futile or unnecessary; characterized by quiet acceptance or submission.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指对不愉快的处境默默接受，不作抗议，通常是因为认为反抗无用或没有必要；表现出平静的顺从或屈从。
definitions.example_en: She gave a resigned sigh, knowing there was nothing she could do to change the outcome.
definitions.example_cn: 她无奈地叹了口气，知道无论如何都无法改变结果。

definitions.explanation_en: To formally give up a position, office, or responsibility, often by submitting a written notice or making a public declaration.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指正式放弃某个职位、职务或责任，通常通过提交书面通知或公开声明来完成。
definitions.example_en: The CEO resigned after the scandal became public.
definitions.example_cn: 丑闻曝光后，首席执行官辞职了。

definitions.explanation_en: To accept something reluctantly but without further resistance, often implying a sense of defeat or surrender.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指不情愿但不再反抗地接受某事，常带有失败或屈服的意味。
definitions.example_en: He resigned himself to the fact that he would never see his hometown again.
definitions.example_cn: 他接受了再也无法回到故乡的现实。

comparison.analysis: “Quit” (退出/放弃) 更口语化，强调主动终止某种行为或状态，不一定涉及正式程序，也不一定带有情感色彩。而 “resign” 通常用于正式职位的辞去，带有程序性和礼仪性，且常隐含对现实的无奈接受。
“Yield” (让步/屈服) 强调在压力、对抗或竞争中放弃立场或权利，通常涉及与他人互动中的妥协。而 “resign” 更多是个人对处境的内在接受，不一定涉及外部对抗。
“Abandon” (抛弃/遗弃) 意味着彻底丢弃、不再关心或负责，常带有负面或情感决绝的色彩。而 “resign” 不一定意味着完全抛弃，而是有意识地放下责任或接受现实，情感上更克制、更内敛。
